programme.desc: Chris attempts to cross the length of Cuba, the only island in the Caribbean to boast an extensive railway network, starting in Havana in the west. programme.desc: Historian and broadcaster Tristram Hunt examines the social class's origins. He discovers how the backlash against the landed aristocracy began with a group of radical thinkers who craved progress and used their money from industry to begin a process of urban enlightenment. However, the growth of mass production led the newly moneyed leaders to move further away from the factories, beginning the trend for suburban living as a mark of status - though it meant the middle classes turning their back on where they came from.

programme.title: Wild Africa
programme.desc: Documentary focusing the mountains of Africa, home to many rarely seen species. From the snow-covered peaks of Kilimanjaro to the Ethiopian Highlands where temperatures fall as low as -20C, wildlife continues to thrive, including the rat-catching wolves which revel in their rodent-infested territory and bone-smashing vultures with a taste for marrow. Unique habits and survival instincts are all on display as the unpredictability and numerous threats to mountain life are revealed.

programme.desc: The award-winning US singer gives an account of her life, looking back on her upbringing in Brooklyn, and the subsequent success she enjoyed as part of husband-and-wife songwriting team Goffin and King in the 1960s, including the creation of global hits Take Good Care of My Baby, The Locomotion and Will You Love Me Tomorrow. By 1970, Carole was divorced and had moved to Los Angeles, where she created her classic solo album Tapestry. Now in her seventies, she reveals herself to be as much an environmental activist as a musician, lobbying Congress in defence of the wildlife and eco-systems in her beloved Idaho.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.sub-title: The World Will Always Welcome Lovers
programme.desc: The truth about Alistair's wedding nerves is revealed after he and Lionel spill the beans, but Rocky comes to the rescue to ensure the ceremony finally takes place. Jean refuses to give up on her efforts to play Cupid between Harry and Sandy.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Hobbo discovers that an infirm friend needs help to bury his pet in the churchyard, and calls on Alvin and Entwistle to carry out the deed. However, the mission becomes complicated when the police begin to suspect the trio are up to no good. Comedy, starring Russ Abbot, Burt Kwouk and Brian Murphy.

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The mismatched detectives investigate the murder of businessman Richard Mattis and discover a family tormented by sinister secrets. A second body found in the canal behind Mattis's factory makes matters even more puzzling. Warren Clarke, Colin Buchanan and Alison Steadman star.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Jack examines a case previously undertaken by a deceased colleague, who was convinced that the alleged suicide of a journalist was a cover-up by the American government. Enlisting the help of a UFO-spotter, the team discovers the reporter witnessed a mysterious air crash near a US Air Force base, and the retired officers try to track down the original personnel to get some answers. Guest starring Mark Williams, Glynis Barber, Michael Brandon and Raquel Cassidy, with Amanda Redman.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Part one of two. A man admitted to hospital after a traffic accident turns out to be one of two children who disappeared without trace 15 years previously. At the time, a nationwide manhunt failed to produce any answers, and now the cold case squad investigates where the missing boy has been all this time and whether his twin sister is still alive. Detective drama, starring Trevor Eve.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Gina tries to quell suspicion about her unexplained absences by going on the beat with Amber and Dan - only to be punched hard in the stomach by a suspect. Smithy reprimands Margaret and Roger for gossiping about Ramani's state of mind, and Honey prepares to lie on Scott's behalf in a bid to get him out of jail, while Lance pledges to leave no stone unturned in his quest to secure incriminating evidence against gangster Adi Mateen.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: A routine inspection of a theatre ends in tragedy when a lighting rig falls on top of Colin. Elsewhere, Hallam considers taking on a job outside the brigade.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward presents from Birmingham's Uplands Allotment, where an array of unusual plants and vegetables are on display.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The officers find themselves stuck in Kenya's Makindi province, struggling to find a safe pick up point. Meanwhile, Dave and Donna are unsure about their future together.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Jeremy announces he is planning to marry his girlfriend, but is surprised at his friends' response. Meanwhile, Cate Hobbs receives bad news.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: A Lack of Control - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of two. Jack officially opens the newly rebuilt station, while Adam's grief at the loss of his entire family in a fatal car crash is compounded by suggestions that wife Denise drove through a red light while talking on her mobile phone. Phil tempts fate by flirting with Samantha, while Suzie monitors a recently released child abuser, but makes the mistake of contacting his daughter - who is so distressed that she attempts suicide shortly afterwards.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Abra returns to Holby with his nephew, who needs an urgent transplant. Ric is unable to operate because of the injury to his hand - but he relents when the patient's mother reveals a secret. Owen fears he might get sacked for hitting Amy's stepfather, thereby jeopardising his access to Katie. Diane tries to keep Laura from turning on her ex, but when she learns about his clandestine relationship with Chrissie, tragedy strikes.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Sean faces a tough time as an injured fireman and his pregnant girlfriend land him with a moral dilemma. Penny helps Josh cope with his gambling addiction and George has a bad day as increasing pressure from Max forces her to burn the midnight oil. Medical drama, starring Derek Thompson, Gerald Kyd and Ian Bleasdale.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Terry races to Ramani's house, where an increasingly unbalanced Margaret Barnes is planning to commit suicide - only to be stabbed and critically injured while attempting to wrest a knife from her. Smithy takes JT to task for spreading gossip around the station, while Dan and Tony try to track down an inventive graffiti artist who uses cleaning products to produce negative images on dirty walls around Sun Hill. It's certainly a novel approach - but does it really constitute a crime?.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Sharon and Phil's infatuation with each other is starting to affect the pub and garage as they are devoting more time to each other rather then their work.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Phil visits Grant in prison and tells him Ricky is going off to work for Frank. Aiden learns he may not be able to play again.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Ariadne pleads with Nick to marry her, Billy is setting Kevin up with Tina, and it seems Patty and Hallam might be hitting it off. Later, a policeman is stuck in a muddy pool.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: As everyone comes to terms with the shocking events, Lexie fears Hector's dire prediction may come true and the wedding will be jinxed. Her anxieties are increased when her mother arrives at Glenbogle in dramatic fashion, immediately treading on Molly's toes by taking control. Alastair Mackenzie, Dawn Steele and Susan Hampshire star.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: David plans a surprise party for Karen's 40th birthday, even though she'd rather not bother, and Anna rekindles her romance with Simon now he's returned from Australia a single man once more. Jess is devastated to receive disappointing A level results, meaning she can't get away from home, and newcomers the Morecroft family arrive in Skelthwaite, hoping to shake off their tragic past.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Nellie ensures Aveline and her first granddaughter are brought home in style. Leonora continues to fascinate the Boswell boys.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: The mystery of the body in the swimming pool continues. Anxious not to alarm the guests, Clive orders the pool lights to be turned off so that the corpse cannot be seen - but instead Fred and the Yellowcoats plunge the whole camp into darkness.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: In an attempt to spite Lionel, Jean decides to make a play for his publisher Alistair. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: In a bid to persuade Pearl to take back her errant husband, Howard's friends try to convince her he is living as a tramp - but he is far from happy at the prospect of going it alone in the wilderness. Meanwhile, Toby's attempt to regain Monica's affections is thwarted by a dog, and Marina decides to dress down for a change. Comedy, starring Russ Abbot, Robert Fyfe and Juliette Kaplan.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.desc: Murdoch helps an Italian detective recover a shipload of stolen antiquities and Brackenreid considers shipping out altogether.

programme.title: The Doctor Blake Mysteries
programme.desc: The medic investigates the death of a strangled young gypsy girl, and must tread carefully as prejudice rears its head. Drama, starring Craig MacLachlan.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Gerry celebrates his birthday at a comedy club, where a controversial act comes under fire from a group of hecklers. Sandra discovers the most vocal member of the gang is the niece of a political activist who went missing 25 years previously after waging a campaign against the comedian. Agreeing to reinvestigate the disappearance, the squad discovers that the activist and her boyfriend had infiltrated an extreme right-wing group with links to the dangerous criminal who murdered Jack's wife. Guest starring Phil Daniels, Joe Absolom and John Henshaw.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The appeal of a man convicted of murder and mutilation forces Grace to question the decision she made on the case 30 years ago. Someone who appears to be copying his chilling tactics sends the team footage of a new victim having his finger cut off. At the same time, Grace receives threats and a macabre package - a jar of pickled, severed fingers. Sue Johnston and Trevor Eve star.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Terry races to Ramani's house, where an increasingly unbalanced Margaret Barnes is planning to commit suicide - only to be stabbed and critically injured while attempting to wrest a knife from her. Smithy takes JT to task for spreading gossip around the station, while Dan and Tony try to track down an inventive graffiti artist who uses cleaning products to produce negative images on dirty walls around Sun Hill. It's certainly a novel approach - but does it really constitute a crime?.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Ariadne pleads with Nick to marry her, Billy is setting Kevin up with Tina, and it seems Patty and Hallam might be hitting it off. Later, a policeman is stuck in a muddy pool.

programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Gina tries to quell suspicion about her unexplained absences by going on the beat with Amber and Dan - only to be punched hard in the stomach by a suspect. Smithy reprimands Margaret and Roger for gossiping about Ramani's state of mind, and Honey prepares to lie on Scott's behalf in a bid to get him out of jail, while Lance pledges to leave no stone unturned in his quest to secure incriminating evidence against gangster Adi Mateen.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Gabriel and Sheelagh put their kiss behind them and work as a team, while Honey's wedding day ends in a brawl, forcing the registrar to abandon the ceremony. Smithy frets over Gina's refusal to take things easy, and Adam suffers a personal tragedy, leaving him racked with guilt at putting his job before the demands and responsibilities of family life.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: The nuns and midwives move into their new premises following the explosion that wrecked the old Nonnatus House, and are joined by fresh arrival Sister Winifred - a kindly-but-naive young woman. Jenny becomes concerned about new mother Merle's mental state and the welfare of her baby, who isn't feeding properly. Dr Turner believes it could be something more serious - although the mystery is eventually solved by the last person anyone would have expected. Chummy is struggling to adjust to her new role as a housewife and mother, and organises an open day at the community centre. Jessica Raine, Stephen McGann and Miranda Hart star.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Trixie's feathers are ruffled when Jenny is promoted, but the new Acting Sister has more to worry about after a mother-to-be reveals the baby she is carrying was not fathered by her husband - and to complicate matters, the real father is black. Cynthia is inspired by a lecture on natural childbirth, convinced it will help an overly anxious patient, while Alec and his friends try to persuade Jenny to join them on a CND march. Jessica Raine, Helen George and Bryony Hannah star in the 1950s-set nursing drama.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Sister Julienne receives an SOS from Holloway Prison, whose usual maternity workers have been struck down by illness, and when she and Trixie step in to help, the nun puts her reputation on the line to prevent a heavily pregnant convict having her unborn baby taken away by social services. Shelagh faces heartache when a routine pregnancy check reveals something far more serious, Alec has a confession for Jenny, and Fred takes the gang to the theatre to celebrate Chummy's birthday - only for the trip to end in disaster. Lacey Turner, best known as EastEnders' Stacey Branning, guest stars.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Jenny has an eventful few days, starting with a patient who as well as having herself to worry about, is also struggling to cope with her mother, an agoraphobic who hasn't been outside for at least 12 years. On top of that, Alec asks the midwife to accompany him to Brighton for the weekend, leaving her wondering if his intentions are strictly honourable. However, things soon take a tragic turn. Meanwhile, Shelagh joins the local choir to take her mind off her problems. Jessica Raine, Leo Staar and Laura Main star.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: The nuns and midwives are busy preparing for Sister Evangelina's surprise jubilee celebrations, marking 50 years since she took her vows, but a face from the past threatens to ruin the party for the guest of honour. It's back to business when a young woman with Down's syndrome is brought in feeling unwell. To everyone's surprise, they discover she is six months pregnant, causing some of them to think the worst, and the staff are joined by new nurse Patsy, whose sense of humour and no-nonsense attitude make her an instant hit.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Trixie is chuffed when local curate Tom invites her to join him for a day of cricket, sending her to work with a spring in her step. Is love on the cards for the young midwife? Shelagh's infertility has made her think long and hard about what she wants in life, so she approaches her husband with an idea, while Patsy upsets a young mother in the clinic and is moved to the district rota, where she works tirelessly to diagnose a docker's unusual symptoms.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Cynthia is concerned during a visit as she feels new mum Pamela is overly anxious, so Dr Turner arranges for a psychiatrist to come in. However, they soon discover both mother and baby have gone missing. Meanwhile, Jenny, on secondment, begins to see cracks in the establishment, Chummy discovers her mother has walked out on her father, and Trixie struggles to hide her disappointment when Tom cancels a date. Guest starring Sophie Rundle (The Bletchley Circle).

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Jenny is assigned to first-time mother Jeanette, who requires frequent visits during a protracted labour, and when she meets her patient's cousin, Philip, a new friendship begins to grow for the midwife. Meanwhile, Chummy worries about her mother's illness when she discovers Lady Browne has discharged herself from hospital. Jessica Raine and Miranda Hart star.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.desc: Crabtree and John are transporting a convicted axe murderer to prison when she escapes to exact revenge on those who testified against her.

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: An alleged sexual assault requires delicate handling. The boat where the attack took place belongs to a friend of the Commissioner, forcing the detectives to go undercover at a fancy dress party as they attempt to arrest their suspect. With only circumstantial evidence and a victim of unreliable character, Ray surprises his colleagues by proving he has a gentler side, gaining the confidence of a young witness.

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: Gene comes up against a socialist feminist group when a man's death he initially treated as suicide becomes the subject of a murder inquiry. Chris uses the arrest of every member as an opportunity to impress Shaz with his knowledge of women's issues, while Ray dates a communist. An intriguing code found by Alex and deciphered by the desk sergeant leads the team closer to the truth.

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: A respected Polish-born doctor is prosecuted for his alleged involvement in Nazi war crimes during the Second World War, forcing victims of persecution to relive their harrowing experiences in concentration camps. Kavanagh finds it difficult to remain professionally detached from such an emotive case and discovers that, after 50 years, witness testimony is not always reliable. Legal drama, starring John Thaw, Frederick Treves, Warren Mitchell and Peter Firth.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: The sleuth delves into a suspicious death, while loyal sidekick Geoffrey and her put-upon husband Robert become involved in a delicate undercover operation. While the police seem satisfied that there was no foul play, the dead man's brother believes that the housekeeper is a fraud who has systematically stolen property from him.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: The sleuth is called upon to mediate in a dispute at a condemned block of flats, and soon discovers the man responsible for their construction has a shady past. Further investigations send the part-time sleuth on a tense race against time as she strives to prevent the cowboy builder from profiting from his shoddy work. Detective drama, starring Patricia Routledge.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Danny goes extreme window cleaning, but will he be brave enough to abseil down the building and avoid the forfeit?.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Fizz, controlling a robot, distributes ice cream to everyone in the city. When Magoo mistakes him for a monster, he gets sprayed with ice cream..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.sub-title: At the Heart of the Crater
programme.desc: Magoo thinks that he is at the foot of a volcano, but in fact, he's next to a huge soup vat. And he sets it all awry..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Fizz invents a cucumber that turns people into an object of worship. When Magoo sees people being drawn to Fizz and Weasel, he thinks it's zombies!.

programme.title: Scrambled!
programme.desc: Two hours of children's fun and entertainment.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean is on his way to the seaside when the mini runs out of petrol. Undeterred he manages to get a push, but for some reason the do-gooders don't want to push him all the way to the beach!.

programme.title: Ben 10
programme.desc: Back stateside, Ben can't get into a cat cosplay competition.

programme.title: Kung Fu Panda: The Paws of Destiny
programme.sub-title: Sacrifice at the Edge of Time
programme.desc: Po decides it's time to figure out a way to defeat Jindiao once and for all before time runs out..

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania
programme.desc: Mavis gives Hank a basketball.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: Cookery show presented by John Torode and Lisa Faulkner, featuring recipes, shortcuts, inspiration and tips. The first episode features spring roast chicken, a fruity curry, Victoria sponge, cheat's raspberry jam and easy cheese scones, and a simple souffle.

programme.title: Ainsley's Mediterranean Cookbook
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott embarks on a journey across the Mediterranean on a 44ft catamaran, preparing a variety of delicious recipes along the way. In this first edition, skipper Jean-Hughes teaches him the basics of sailing, and they drop anchor in a crystal-clear cove on the island of Lavezzi, where Ainsley tries his hand at paddle-boarding. The chef then prepares seafood skewers with pepperonata, and a quick and tasty Corsican mint omelette.

programme.title: Best Walks with a View with Julia Bradbury
programme.desc: The expert walker chooses her favourite, most accessible family treks in search of the perfect walk with a view that anyone can tackle in a morning or afternoon ramble, venturing off the beaten track and discovering some of Britain's most breath-taking scenery.

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: Emma Willis hosts the second Knockout round, as 12 acts perform for a place in the live semi-final. Coaches Will.i.am, Tom Jones, Olly Murs and Meghan Trainor are in the red chairs as the acts they have chosen from the blind auditions and the Battle Rounds fight for a place on their coach's team.

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway
programme.desc: The popular duo return with another edition of the Saturday evening variety show, albeit without a studio audience for the first time ever due to the ongoing coronavirus pandemic. Tom Jones will be taking to the stage to perform on this week's End of The Show Show, while Bradley Walsh becomes the first repeat victim of Undercover when Ant and Dec invade an episode of The Chase. Plus, keep an eye out for Fleur East, who has another Place on the Plane to give away.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Schoolteacher Connie Bishop keeps waking in the night, convinced she has an intruder, but most of the villagers in Badger's Drift dismiss her fears as an overactive imagination. Days later, a local councillor thought to have been obsessed with her is found murdered in her garden, and the ensuing investigation by Barnaby and Jones uncovers jealous rivals, ruthless social climbers and a cottage with a few secrets. Guest starring Paul Kaye, with John Nettles and Jason Hughes.

programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show, asking Strictly head judge Shirley Ballas, actress Bhavna Limbachia and This Morning's resident GP Dr Ranj Singh to 'see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. The players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win 50,000 for their chosen charities.

programme.title: The Family Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh hosts a family-themed edition of the game show. Here, instead of teaming up with strangers, the Hartes from Co Antrim work alongside their family members as they pit their general-knowledge know-how against one of the finest quiz brains in the country.

programme.title: The Good Karma Hospital
programme.desc: A medical train rolls into town, providing miracle surgeries and carrying a surprise for Gabriel - a glamorous older surgeon from his past. While he is reminiscing with his old colleague, a vicious attack on one of the team shocks the medics and leaves Lydia reeling, and an elderly British man arrives in India on a romantic mission. Can the doctors help him in his quest? Medical drama set in southern India, starring Amanda Redman, James Krishna Floyd, Neil Morrissey and Amrita Acharia, with a guest appearance by Kenneth Cranham.

credits.actor: a guest appearance by Kenneth Cranham

programme.title: Belgravia
programme.desc: Anne decides that honesty is required, and hopes that seeking confession with Caroline will appease her guilt and lay to rest the ghosts from her past. However, she has sorely underestimated Lady Brockenhurst, who sets about unearthing the secrets that bind the families together. Hosting a prestigious dinner party, she invites a special guest whose presence reveals a deceit James Trenchard would wish to keep private.

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Hidden Caribbean: Havana to Haiti
programme.desc: Part two of two. Joanna completes her Cuban journey by visiting the infamous town of Guantanamo. Giving the prison a wide berth, she discovers that the song Guantanamera was born in the town, and meets a talented young singer who is recording the track herself. She then heads across the Windward Passage to Haiti, currently the poorest country in the Western World. She visits the Citadel, a mighty fortress built to deter colonial powers, before taking in a Voodoo ceremony on the Iles a Vaches.

programme.title: The Trouble with Maggie Cole
programme.desc: Peter Cole is worried about the press interest following Maggie's interview and the online petition calling for his resignation over the scandal. Meanwhile, Alex is greeted at work by two money lenders, who have found him because his girlfriend Roxanna's picture appeared in the papers. Author Marcus Ormansby gives a talk at the school, and finds that romance is blossoming between him and Jill. Later, Maggie's visit to Kelly's salon is tense, but they have a heart to heart, leading Kelly to return home to husband Neil and take action over their 'lottery' money.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: A team of five family and friends answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: More celebrity interviews and topical debate from a female perspective.
